decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. It includes powerful threats like Phelia and Phlage, along with card advantage and removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending. The deck aims to control the battlefield through creatures and disruptive spells while presenting a fast clock for the opponent to deal with. Using a mix of creatures and spells, this deck looks to disrupt the opponent's game plan and assert dominance on the battlefield.

The deck revolves around utilizing cost reduction effects like Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate mana quickly and cast spells for free or at a reduced cost. By chaining together cheap spells like Pyretic Ritual and Reckless Impulse, the deck aims to storm off and generate a large amount of mana to win the game with a combo finisher like Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes cards like Past in Flames and Wish to recur important spells or find key pieces to further its combo potential.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key combo pieces using cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate, before using Goryo's Vengeance to bring back powerful creatures such as Griselbrand for a game-winning reanimation combo. The deck also runs disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. With a mix of control elements and powerful reanimation, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its instant reanimator strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out cheap artifacts to take advantage of synergy between them and reduce their casting cost, allowing for explosive starts and overwhelming opponents with aggressive plays. By using cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to flood the board with artifacts, generating card advantage through cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thoughtcast. The inclusion of cards like Engineered Explosives and Kappa Cannoneer helps to control the board and maintain a steady pace of aggression.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with resilient threats like Solitude and Stoneforge Mystic. By utilizing powerful enter-the-battlefield abilities and efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection for key threats, while cards like Ephemerate and March of Otherworldly Light offer valuable card advantage and protection. The deck's versatile and flexible nature allows for adaptability in a variety of matchups.

This deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence by utilizing artifacts and creatures that can be quickly played. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Urza's Saga to search for key artifacts like Arcbound Ravager and Engineered Explosives, while also utilizing Tormod's Crypt to disrupt opponent's graveyard strategies. By combining quick artifact plays with card draw mechanics like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast, this Aggro-Affinity deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence.

The deck focuses on using cheap and efficient spells to quickly attack the opponent and pressure them with aggressive creatures. It also includes card selection and mana fixing to maintain consistency and adaptability. By utilizing a mix of burn spells, pump spells, and aggressive creatures, the deck aims to maintain a proactive game plan and apply constant pressure on the opponent to disrupt their game plan and secure a fast victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing various creatures to create a powerful toolbox of options, enabling combos that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By tutoring for specific creatures with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling, players can assemble key pieces like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide to control the board and generate advantage. The deck also includes cards like Delighted Halfling and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt opponents and maintain tempo, while cards like Young Wolf and Walking Ballista provide consistent threats on the battlefield. With careful planning and precise execution, this deck can outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The deck aims to accelerate mana production with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to quickly cast big Eldrazi Titans like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements such as Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Writhing Chrysalis provide additional value and protection. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly ramping up and overpowering the opponent with big Eldrazi creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a variety of counter spells and utility creatures to protect and enable the combo of Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom for a fast win condition. The deck focuses on manipulating the opponent's board state while setting up the necessary pieces to deal a massive amount of damage in a single turn. By utilizing disruptive elements and resource management, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory without needing traditional land plays.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through ramping up mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse, allowing for the quick play of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck also includes removal spells like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Malevolent Rumble and Writhing Chrysalis to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big, impactful creatures while maintaining control of the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, backed up by powerful removal and disruptive cards. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast creature damage while controlling the board with removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. Key cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional pressure and threat. The deck also utilizes versatile cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory for card advantage and flexibility. Overall, the strategy is to bring the opponent's life total to zero as quickly as possible.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early game plays using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to control the board. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provides a powerful finisher, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory offer additional support for the aggro strategy. The deck's mana base is streamlined with fetchlands like Arid Mesa and Windswept Heath to ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful threats.

This deck focuses on generating fast mana, drawing cards, and casting spells to create a powerful storm turn that wins the game in a single explosive turn. By using cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual to produce mana, alongside cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to deal damage, the deck aims to create a storm count high enough to overwhelm the opponent in a short amount of time. By utilizing unique cards like Reckless Impulse and Wrenn's Resolve, the deck can maintain consistency and speed in achieving its goal.

This deck focuses on creating a synergistic combo with creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker, using Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board while accumulating counters with Blade of the Bloodchief. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings helps to tutor for key cards, while Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a finisher. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature presence and removal spells, utilizing different angles of attack to secure victory.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy using a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by cards like Lightning Bolt and Leyline of the Guildpact to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes counterspells like Stubborn Denial to protect its threats and disruption cards like Consign to Memory to control the opponent's board. The mana base is built around fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for spells and creatures.
